message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.AR. 

The paper discusses the implementation of a real-time testbed for a 3D hybrid beamforming system for 5G wireless networks. This involves the use of software-defined radio (SDR) platforms and antenna arrays, which are typically studied in the computer networks and communications (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of system-level simulations based on a 3D ray-tracing tool, which falls under the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of smart small cell systems, which can be considered as a multimedia (cs.MM) application. The implementation of the system involves the use of hardware and software components, which can be studied under the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses the use of beamforming techniques, which can be studied under the computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.AR) sub-category.
